title: Example case indexable by original urls
summary: The OFT issued an infringement in which it found that certain supermarkets and cheese processors infringed competition law and imposed penalties totalling almost £50 million. Tesco has filed an appeal against that decision in the Competition Appeal Tribunal. No other party has appealed. [Click here to view case page](http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20140402141250/http://www.oft.gov.uk/OFTwork/competition-act-and-cartels/ca98-current/dairy-products/) [Back to top ](#content "Return to the top of the page")
body:
#  Sports bras RPM investigation 



**Case Reference:** CE/9610-12  
 **Start date:** April 2012


## Summary of work

In April 2012, the OFT launched a formal investigation under Chapter I
of the Competition Act 1998 and Article 101 of the Treaty on the
Functioning of the European Union into suspected anti-competitive
arrangements relating to sports bras.

On 20 September 2013, the OFT issued a Statement of Objections alleging
that DB Apparel UK Limited entered into anti-competitive agreements with
each of John Lewis plc, Debenhams Retail plc and House of Fraser
(Stores) Limited between 2008 and 2011. The Statement of Objections
alleges that these agreements had the aim of increasing the prices of
DBA\'s Shock Absorber brand of sports bras in each of the three
retailers.

The parties now have an opportunity to respond to the Statement of
Objections before the OFT decides whether competition law has in fact
been infringed.

For further details, see press release [OFT issues Statement of
Objections to sports bra supplier and three UK department
stores](http://www.oft.gov.uk/news-and-updates/press/2013/64-13) (20
September 2013).

## Case timetable

First published: 16 October 2012

| **Milestone** |  **Date** |
| Investigation opened | April 2012   
 (actual) |
| Initial investigation: information gathering, including issuance of formal or informal information requests and parties\' responses | April - July 2012  
 (actual) |
| - OFT analysis and review of parties\' responses to information requests  
 - Issue of further information requests (if necessary)  
 - Internal governance processes to decide investigation outcome | June 2012 - February 2013 (actual) |
| Investigation outcome (issue of Statement of Objections; case closure - see [Procedural Guidance](http://www.oft.gov.uk/about-the-oft/legal-powers/legal/competition-act-1998/ca98-procedures-guidance)) | Statement of Objections issued on 20 September 2013 (actual) |
| Period for written representations on the Statement of Objections | December 2013 (actual) |
| OFT consideration of parties\' written and oral representations on the Statement of Objections | April to August 2014 (estimate) |
| (i) Final decision on case outcome (whether there has been an infringement; case closure) if no further significant investigative/procedural steps necessary | September 2014 (estimate) |
| (ii) Final decision on case outcome (whether there has been an infringement); case closure) if significant investigative/procedural steps necessary (for example issue of a Supplementary Statement of Objections) | March 2015 (estimate) |

   
   
  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

**Notes:**

* Changes to the timing of original entries in the case timetable will
  be made where the estimated timing in the [original
  timetable](http://www.oft.gov.uk/shared_oft/ca98_public_register/Investigations/Leisure_Goods_timetable.pdf) changes.


## Change log

The following changes have been made to the original estimates in the
administrative timetable since it was first published in October 2012.
[See original timetable  
   
 ](http://www.oft.gov.uk/shared_oft/ca98_public_register/Investigations/Leisure_Goods_timetable.pdf)


| **Date of change** | **Reason for change** | **Nature of change(s) made to timetable** |
| February 2014  | Extensions provided to parties to submit written representations and timing of oral representations delayed. Also, further investigative steps may potentially be required. | Estimated timing of investigation outcome put back from March 2014 to September 2014 or March 2015 (see above) |
